page.title: 11FARMING - SULLINGTON
page.content: The farms in Sullington occupy the following acreage. Church Farm, 35 acres. New owner breeds Connemara Ponies. Highden Farm, 800 acres. Mainly arable with a few sheep. Chantry Farm and Greyfriars Farm, 320 acres. Mainly cereal crops, with some cattle and a few sheep. Gerston Farm, 52 acrea. Mainly wheat with intensive calf rearing. Barns Farm, 200 acres. Mainly cattle, with some 50 acres put to corn. Clayton Farm, 120 acres. Cattle. Parkfield Farm, 5 acres. Pigs and poultry. Sullington Manor Farm, 550 acres. Cattle, corn, with a small area given to Pick your own Strawberries and Potatoes.
